references.paper_title: Deep generative models of genetic variation capture the effects of mutations
references.reason: This paper is foundational to the field of deep learning for protein variant effect prediction, introducing a generative model approach.

references.paper_title: Biological structure and function emerge from scaling unsupervised learning to 250 million protein sequences
references.reason: This paper demonstrates the power of large-scale unsupervised learning methods in protein structure prediction and function inference.

references.paper_title: Accurate proteome-wide missense variant effect prediction with AlphaMissense
references.reason: This paper showcases a state-of-the-art model for missense variant effect prediction, pushing the boundaries of prediction accuracy.

references.paper_title: AlphaFold Protein Structure Database in 2024: Providing Structure Coverage for over 214 Million Protein Sequences
references.reason: This paper presents a massive expansion of the AlphaFold protein structure database, providing crucial data for many machine learning models.

references.paper_title: ProteinGym: Large-Scale Benchmarks for Protein Fitness Prediction and Design
references.reason: This paper introduces a comprehensive benchmark dataset (ProteinGym) specifically designed for evaluating protein variant effect prediction methods, providing a standardized evaluation framework.
